meanings.definition: A piece of cloth or similar material hung at the back of a stage as part of the scenery.
meanings.sent1: The backcloth on the stage was painted with a beautiful forest scene.
meanings.sent2: The actors performed in front of the backcloth to create the illusion of a grand castle.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the backcloth suddenly fell down, revealing the crew behind it!
meanings.sent4: The backcloth of the theater was like a magical portal transporting the audience to another world.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the backcloth made the entire stage come alive.

meanings.definition: The background against which something is viewed or depicted.
meanings.sent1: The mountain served as a majestic backcloth for the picturesque village.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully chose a neutral backcloth to enhance the colors of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The backcloth of the photograph accidentally captured a photobombing squirrel!
meanings.sent4: The stormy sky acted as a dramatic backcloth for the intense battle scene.
meanings.sent5: The starry night sky was a perfect backcloth for the romantic proposal.
